00027 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00028 #include "kvi_pointerlist.h"
00029 #include "kvi_string.h"
00030 #include "kvi_qstring.h"
00031 #include "kvi_console.h"
00032 
00033 class KviIrcConnection;
00034 class KviIrcContext;
00035 class KviConneciton;
00036 
00037 #define KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_HALTOUTPUT 1
00038 #define KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_UNRECOGNIZED 2
00039 
00040 //
00041 // This is a single IRC message received from the server.
00042 // The message is strictly associated to the connection it came from.
00043 //
00044 // The IRC protocol is strictly 8 bit and thus the strings
00045 // are all 8 bit strings. The decoding of these strings should
00046 // be done on the targeting context (mainly channel or query...)
00047 //
00048 
00049 class KVIRC_API KviIrcMessage
00050 {
00051 public:
00052         KviIrcMessage(const char * message,KviIrcConnection * pConnection);
00053         ~KviIrcMessage();
00054 private:
00055         const char          * m_ptr;                // shallow! never null
00056         KviStr                m_szPrefix;           // the extracted prefix string
00057         KviStr                m_szCommand;          // the extracted command (may be numeric)
00058         KviPointerList<KviStr>  * m_pParams;            // the list of parameters
00059         KviConsole          * m_pConsole;           // the console we're attacched to
00060         KviIrcConnection    * m_pConnection;        // the connection we're attacched to
00061         int                   m_iNumericCommand;    // the numeric of the command (0 if non numeric)
00062         int                   m_iFlags;             // yes.. flags :D
00063 public:
00064         KviConsole       * console(){ return m_pConsole; };
00065         KviIrcConnection * connection(){ return m_pConsole->connection(); };
00066 
00067         bool               isNumeric(){ return (m_iNumericCommand >= 0); };
00068         const char       * command(){ return m_szCommand.ptr(); };
00069         KviStr           * commandPtr(){ return &m_szCommand; };
00070         int                numeric(){ return m_iNumericCommand; };
00071 
00072         KviStr           * prefixPtr(){ return &m_szPrefix; };
00073         const char       * prefix(){ return m_szPrefix.ptr(); };
00074         const char       * safePrefix();
00075         bool               hasPrefix(){ return m_szPrefix.hasData(); };
00076 
00077         bool               isEmpty(){ return (m_szPrefix.isEmpty() && m_szCommand.isEmpty() && m_pParams->isEmpty()); };
00078 
00079         int                paramCount(){ return m_pParams->count(); };
00080 
00081         const char       * param(unsigned int idx){ return (idx < m_pParams->count()) ? m_pParams->at(idx)->ptr() : 0; };
00082 
00083         const char       * safeParam(unsigned int idx){ return (idx < m_pParams->count()) ? m_pParams->at(idx)->ptr() : KviStr::emptyString().ptr(); };
00084 
00085         KviStr           * paramString(unsigned int idx){ return m_pParams->at(idx); };
00086 
00087         const char       * trailing(){ KviStr * tr = m_pParams->last(); return tr ? tr->ptr() : 0; };
00088         KviStr           * trailingString(){ return m_pParams->last(); };
00089         KviStr           & safeTrailingString(){ KviStr * tr = m_pParams->last(); return tr ? *tr : KviStr::emptyString(); };
00090         const char       * safeTrailing(){ KviStr * tr = m_pParams->last(); return tr ? tr->ptr() : KviStr::emptyString().ptr(); };
00091 
00092         const char       * allParams(){ return m_ptr; };
00093 
00094         KviStr           * firstParam(){ return m_pParams->first(); };
00095         KviStr           * nextParam(){ return m_pParams->next(); };
00096 
00097         void               setHaltOutput(){ m_iFlags |= KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_HALTOUTPUT; };
00098         bool               haltOutput(){ return (m_iFlags & KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_HALTOUTPUT); };
00099         void               setUnrecognized(){ m_iFlags |= KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_UNRECOGNIZED; };
00100         bool               unrecognized(){ return (m_iFlags & KVI_IRCMSG_FLAG_UNRECOGNIZED); };
00101 
00102         void decodeAndSplitPrefix(QString &szNick,QString &szUser,QString &szHost);
00103         void decodeAndSplitMask(char * mask,QString &szNick,QString &szUser,QString &szHost);
00104 };
00105 
00106 #endif //_KVI_IRCMESSAGE_H_
